question: Look! You are crying and a little baby. Your mom is washing dishes.

choiceA: Mom will first finish washing dishes.
choiceC: Mom stops washing dishes, and hug you.

question: Your parents are watching the Super Bowl! Oh, you are about to cry.

choiceA: They will watch super bowl with you.
choiceB: They will turn off the TV and check you.
choiceC: Our team is winning! They will ignore you and turn the volume up.

question: Your parents have an argument. And you suddenly start to cry.

choiceA: Parents will stop the argument and look after you.
choiceB: They do not feel good. Keep having the argument.

question: You are about to cry. Who is around you?
You are now a toddler. You want to go outside and play at the playground with parents. What does your parent say?

choiceC: Stop. You can only go outside when we are not busy.

question: Which toys do you want to play with?
You made a mud pie for your mom and she was not happy that I got mud all over my pants.

choiceA: I will not make her another one.
choiceB: I will make until she’s happy.

question: You made a paper windmill for Dad and it made him happy.

choiceA: I will make him another one.

question: You made a paper flower for your friend and it made him/her happy.
choiceA: Make another paper flower for her.
choiceB: Take a paper flower from her when she feels happy and tear it apart.

question: You were with mom, and found a hungry dog.

choiceA: I feel guilty, so I’ll ask my mom if we could feed him/her.

question: Yeah! You are now at school! Where are you at school in terms of academic achievement?
What did you do when you struggled with your homework?

choiceA: I always asked for help from people around me: teachers, parents, friends… everyone can help me!
choiceB: I usually didn’t ask and I really tried not to! If I ask questions, people will think that I am dumb. Urgh! That shouldn’t happen.

question: How did the people around you respond when you ask for help?

choiceA: They always explained in detail and praised me for asking questions.
choiceB: They were not responsive, but I was able to solve the problems and find my way around.
choiceC: They never responded, and I wasn’t able to learn what I need to learn.

question: Today was the final poster presentation day! What did everyone say?

choiceA: My poster was one of the most popular ones. The poster that I made will be presented in the school hallway!
choiceB: The teacher said I tried hard and some of my friends told me it was good but I know that it’s clearly not one of the best.
choiceC: Nobody clapped after my poster showcase. The past effort has been effortless!

question: You took an exam. How did you do and what did your parents say?

choiceA: I did very well! My parents praised me a lot :)
choiceB: I did not do well but my parents still thanked me for my effort and they said I can do better next time.
choiceC: I did very well! Oh well, but my parents were not interested in my scores as usual. They said nothing.
choiceD: I did not do well…. And my parents scolded me for that. They said if I fail on these easy exams, then I will not do good in the future with even harder exams.
